Package net.finmath.montecarlo.interestrate

Class LIBORMarketModelNormalAADSensitivitiesTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.finmath.montecarlo.interestrate.LIBORMarketModelNormalAADSensitivitiesTest
  • public class LIBORMarketModelNormalAADSensitivitiesTest
extends Object
    This class tests the sensitivities calculated from a LIBOR market model and products. We have test for delta and vega (using AAD and finite differences). The unit test has currently only an assert for a single (selected) bucket, because a finite difference benchmark of all buckets would simply take far too long (hours!). (But I did that benchmark once ;-). For vega: The unit test uses a smaller volatility time discretization to reduce memory requirements and allow the unit test to run on the continuous integration server.
    Author:
    Christian Fries

      • testVega

        public void testVega()
              throws net.finmath.exception.CalculationException
        A test for the LIBOR Market Model vega calculated by AAD. The test calculates all model vegas using AAD, but only one model vega using finite difference to benchmark that one.
        Throws:
        net.finmath.exception.CalculationException - Thrown if valuation inside calibration fails.
